qas.question: The term Ashkenazi also refers to what?
The nusach Ashkenaz refers to what in Hebrew?
Two other major forms of nusach among Ashkenazic Jews are what?

answers.text: Nusach Sefard (not to be confused with the Sephardic ritual), which is the general Polish Hasidic nusach, and Nusach Ari

qas.question: Nusach Ari is used by whom?

context: The term Ashkenazi also refers to <a1_0>the nusach Ashkenaz<a1_0/> (Hebrew, <a2_0>"liturgical tradition", or rite<a2_0/>) used by Ashkenazi Jews in their Siddur (<a0_0>prayer book<a0_0/>). A nusach is defined by a liturgical tradition's choice of prayers, order of prayers, text of prayers and melodies used in the singing of prayers. Two other major forms of nusach among Ashkenazic Jews are <a3_0>Nusach Sefard (not to be confused with the Sephardic ritual), which is the general Polish Hasidic nusach, and Nusach Ari<a3_0/>, as used by <a4_0>Lubavitch Hasidim<a4_0/>.
